title: Random Lag Spikes
body: Very curious as to what causes lag when you go near certain players and how it gets worse later in the game anyone have any ideas on this, lately its been getting alot worse, also I have a 3GHz quad core with 8gb 1.3ghz ddr3 ram lol installed on ssd hdd aswell as OS and a 2GB graphics card aswell as freshly installed pc so its not my end

replies.body:
If it's lag and not on your end, then why would you provide your computer specs?

If it's a loss in frame-rate (the number you see without Ctrl+F) then it's your computer (which can most definitely be fixed if those are your specs (unless you didn't include a graphics card because you don't actually have a graphics card)). If it's legitimate lag (the number you see with Ctrl+F) then it could be either your side or Riot's.

Could you tell me what appears when you run dxdiag.exe, that is if you're on Windows.

PS You mentioned that you have an OS, **implying that it's optional.**

Both frame rate and ping randomly spike, OS is Win7 64bit ultimate, Graphics card is a ati radeon HD 6570 and will run dxdiag.exe when I get home after work, also I mention my pcs specs so my pc or connection is not the first thing to be blamed for this annoying lag.

PS how does a OS become a optional thing ????

>aswell as OS

I presume you meant "as well as an OS", implying that normally people don't get an OS, and that it's an optional extra. You probably meant something else, lol.

If your frame-rate is grinding down as you near other champions, that it pretty much on your end. Your ping spiking up would be a result of your frame-rate going down (it doesn't work the other way around, though, so a high ping will not cause a low frame-rate if your computer was perfectly fine and capable).

Have you updated your graphics drivers recently, along with Windows 7? There have been service packs released, and newer versions of frameworks.

Do you regularly check your computer for viruses and other malicious softwares?
